page.title: 03Market Gardening
page.content: The principal form of farming in our area is market gardening. A large proportion of the land is given over to horticulture. My uncle Ian is a nurseryman in Longton.His land covers one hectare and he has six large greenhouses. His chief crops are lettuce, which is grown throughout the year, and tomato and celery,which are seasonal. On his land he uses an organic based liquid compound fertiliser.He needs to use machinary such as a tractor,a rotavator,and a planting machine and tomato grader as well as good old-fashioned muscle power. Because the land round here is liable to flooding he uses irrigation equipment too.His produce is taken to markets as far apart as Glasgow and Wolverhampton. (Alison Greenwood)
